instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3536 - No v?deo - No Chime
threads.message:
I have a hard time to figure out the problem with this motherboard. If you guys can give me some hints,
i will really appreciate.

Water Damager near by U1900 Replaced
Pin 1 = 3.3V
Pin 13 = 3.4v
Pin 2 = 3.3v  



PPBUS_G3H = 12V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3V
PP5VS5 = 5.1V
PP5VS0 = 5.1V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 3.3V
XDP_JTAG_CPU_ISOL_L = 4.92V
PP3V3_S0 = 3.3V
PP5V_S0_FET = 5.1V
PP3V3_S0_FET = 3.3V
PP1V35_S3_CPUDDR = 1.3V
PP1V35_S3 = 1.3

J8300
SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SCL = 3.3
SMBUS_SMC_0_S0_SDA = 3.3
PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT = 0V _ no short to ground
I2C_BKLT_SCL = 5V
I2C_BKLT_SDA = 5V


PP1V05_SUS = 1.047V
PP1V5_S0 = 1.5V


U7600
Pin 15 = P1V05S0_BOOT_RC = 6.1V
Pin 1 = 1.05V
Pin 16 = 3.3V

threads.title: 820-3536 - No v?deo - No Chime
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H = 12V"
Post the EXACT value there; 12.2V and 12.5V signify completely different things!

Do you get PPVCC_S0_CPU voltage?
Check for USB activity before looking to get video.
See if all voltages from page 60 appear.

Disconnect anything from the MLB, including LCD and RIO board.
Use USB OSX pendrive (or mouse at least) to check if has activity.

U1900 is close enough to SMC.
You could have crap under SMC, or corrosion around J/U6100.
I recommend you to try new BIOS with clean ME too.

threads.title: 820-3536 - No v?deo - No Chime
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H = 12.58V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1.7V
NO USB activity
SMC is pretty clean.

I think is the bios as well.

threads.title: 820-3536 - No v?deo - No Chime
threads.message: Prob bad CPU but could be BIOS
